page.title: 10BUCHLYVIE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Village Hall, built in{1884,}seats 200 people and is an integral part of the community. During the GREAT WAR it was used as an auxiliary hospital from {1914}until{1919.}Today it is used throughout the year by a variety of organisations ranging from the very young to the senior citizens of the village. It is used on a regular weekly basis by the Playgroup, the Youth Club, the Senior Citizens' Lunch Club and the local schoolchildren for P.E. lessons. {SUMMER ICE,}a game unique to rural areas of Scotland is enjoyed by the men of the village and the ladies meet monthly at the { {WOMEN'S RURAL INSTITUTE.}Various committees meet in the Hall and it is in continual use for Sales of Work, Whist Drives, Coffee Evenings etc. The Hall Management Committee, all village residents, raise funds for its upkeep.
